intro: Leucomphalos capparideus, commonly known as the yellow cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellow, four-petaled flowers. It produces slender, elongated seed pods that contain small, round seeds. Leucomphalos capparideus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
